page.title: 07CHANGING TIMES-2
page.content: During the war the present Industrial Estate was owned by the War Agricultural Committee.There is an aircraft hangar still there being used by one of the companies.The village hall used to have a stable under it.There were steps up to it.The floor was much higher than now.In 1926 the floor was lowered so there are no stables there now.This is why the windows are so high.Children had to walk to school.There were no wellington boots like there are now.During the war Condover Hall was occupied by the Auxiliary Territorial Service.After the war it was sold to the Royal National Institute for the Blind.They still own it and it is now a school for the blind.
